title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Instructor: Joel Nitta



Research topic 1: Ecology and evolution of ferns
Research topic 2: Development of software for data science

Reproducible data analysis, Thursdays 3rd period

https://www.joelnitta.com

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Instructor: Joel Nitta



Born and raised in California
Fourth generation Japanese-American
First came to Japan as high school exchange student

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Ice-breaker

Answer the question: “Why are you interested in biodiversity?”
Introduce yourself and discuss with your neighbor

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
What is biodiversity?

The different kinds of life that occur on our planet



Often we talk about the number of species, but it has other definitions too

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why does biodiversity matter?



How would you feel if you could never visit a natural place like a forest or the mountains?




https://images.unsplash.com/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why does biodiversity matter?



How would you feel if you knew that a place like the Great Barrier Reef were to disappear?




https://www.nma.gov.au/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Biodiversity has inherent value

Biodiversity has inherent value: it is worth something just by existing
Biodiversity has cultural value: we derive inspiration from it

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why does biodiversity matter?



How would you feel if you couldn’t eat any fruit because there were no bees to pollinate flowers?




https://upload.wikimedia.org/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Humans depend on biodiversity



How would you feel if you didn’t have access to clean drinking water because there were no wetlands to help filter it?




https://upload.wikimedia.org/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why does biodiversity matter?

Biodiversity provides ecosystem services: humans benefit from the natural environment

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Biodiversity is in danger
We will learn about the specific risks posed to biodiversity, and actionable measures to counteract them.




Climate change
Population growth
Invasive species





https://www.iema.net/articles/climate-change-to-pose-bigger-threat-to-biodiversity-than-land-use-by-2070/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Biodiversity in Japan



Did you know that Japan is a biodiversity hotspot?
Do you know why?




https://hanwellzoo.co.uk/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Japan as a biodiversity hotspot
Japan has a wide variation of climates in a small area


Species are usually adapted for one particular kind of climate
This results in many species

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Goals of this class
By the end of the course, you will be able to:

understand the processes generating biodiversity
explain how biodiversity is distributed globally and in Japan
propose ways to effectively conserve biodiversity

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Expectations of this class

I expect you to participate in discussions
I expect you to ask questions

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Language of this class

This class is conducted in English
But, you can ask questions in Japanese and I will explain in Japanese if needed
日本語でも必要に応じて大丈夫です。
とにかく何か分からないことがあったら、聞いてください！

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Structure of this class

Classic model: Introduce new ideas in class then complete homework assignments about them
Flipped model: Introduce new ideas ahead of class in videos, and we will learn more about those topics in depth through in-class discussions

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Videos

We will watch videos from a series on biodiversity produced by the California Academy of Sciences
Each is video is 5-10 minutes long.
There are usually 3-4 videos per week.

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Intro video


https://www.youtube.com/embed/HpDJBFflYKI

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Quizzes

There will be a short quiz (ca. 5-10 min.) on the content of the video at the start of each class.
Bring your laptop or smartphone to take the quiz on Socrative.

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: About references 引用について
text:
About references 引用について

As mentioned before, you are expected to cite sources in your slides when you use a direct quote, fact, or image
前にも説明したように、スライドで直接的な引用、事実、画像を使用する場合は、出典を引用する必要がある。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: About references 引用について
text:
About references 引用について

I expect you to read and think about the sources you use, and write in your own words (no plagiarism)
使う出典を実際に読んで、そこに書いてあることについてを自ら考えて、文章を書く時は自分の言葉で書くこととなっている（剽窃は厳禁）

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: About references 引用について
text:
About references 引用について

Points will be deducted for copying directly from ChatGPT or Wikipedia without any references or using your own words
ChatGPTやWikipediaから引用なしで自分の言葉を使わずにコピペした場合は原点される

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: About grading 成績について
text:
About grading 成績について

The final project is worth 30 points total 最終プロジェクトは合計３０点満点

Presentation content (group work): 25 points 発表の内容（グループワーク）：２５点
Participation (individual contribution): 5 points 参加（個人の貢献）：５点

You can get 1 extra credit point for asking a question during the presentation Q&A (only once) 発表の質疑応答の時に質問をしたら、１点加算される（一回だけ）

Fill out Form B on Moodle after class, submit by 11:59 PM today (July 25) 授業後に様式BをMoodle上で記入し、本日（７月２５日）の23:59時までに提出してください。

English

title: Biodiversity and Japan

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
What is biodiversity?

The different kinds of life that occur on our planet

To understand biodiversity, we need to document it (describe where it occurs)

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: How can we count (quantify) life?

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Species richness

The number of species 種数

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Population size (abundance)

The number of individuals belonging to a species 個体数

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Biomass

The total mass of organisms 生物量

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Counting life

Richness: The number of species 種数
Population size (abundance): The number of individuals belonging to a species 個体数
Biomass: The total mass of organisms 生物量

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Activity: Which is more diverse?

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Activity: Which is more diverse?



Enter room name JABIOD2024 at https://gosocrative.com or scan the barcode

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Species richness is often used, but is not the only way to measure biodiversity
text:
Species richness is often used, but is not the only way to measure biodiversity
There is no single definition of diversity.
How you measure it depends on your goal and the data available

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Species richness is unevenly distributed
Some areas have many species, others have few.

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Latitudinal species gradient
The number of species increases going from the poles to the equator

latitude = 緯度
equator = 赤道

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Latitudinal species gradient


https://en.wikipedia.org/, https://www.worldatlas.com

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Latitudinal species gradient

Mammal richness 哺乳類の種数
Schipper et al. 2008, Science 225–230

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: There are many factors that determine richness
text:
There are many factors that determine richness

Climate 気候
Biotic interactions 生物間相互作用
Evolution 進化
Humans

These affect ranges of individual species, and species richness

text: Climate

text: Climate

text: Biotic interactions

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Evolution

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Evolution

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Evolution


Vicent et al. Taxon 66, 2017

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Hotspots are areas of exceptionally high richness
text:
Hotspots are areas of exceptionally high richness
Hotspots have high richness and are in danger: these are the areas that we should focus on conserving

種の数が極めて多い
すでにダメージを受けている

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: 35 Global Biodiversity Hotspots

section: Activity: How do you experience biodiversity?
text:
Activity: How do you experience biodiversity?
In your group, discuss:

Where do you see/experience areas of high biodiversity?
Where do you see/experience areas of low biodiversity?
Why do you think there is a difference?

One person per group answer on Socrative

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
What are species anyways?
All of our discussion of biodiversity uses species as a unit (単位)

But what are species?

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Activity: What are species anyways?
In your group, discuss:

What is a species?

One person per group answer on Socrative

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Activity: Join on Socrative



Enter room name JABIOD2024 at https://gosocrative.com or scan the barcode

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Activity: Find your team name

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Activity: Team Seating Chart

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Species concepts

There is no one right answer to the question, “What are species?”
Instead, there are different species concepts

種概念、「種」の定義

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Biological Species Concept (BSC)生物学的種概念
text:
Biological Species Concept (BSC)生物学的種概念

According to the BSC, species are groups of individuals that can interbreed with each other, but not other species

interbreed = 繁殖する

Appearance does not matter

見た目は関係ない

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Western meadowlark vs. Eastern meadowlark (different species)
text:
Western meadowlark vs. Eastern meadowlark (different species)


https://evolution.berkeley.edu/biological-species-concept/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Ant castes (same species)


https://evolution.berkeley.edu/biological-species-concept/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Horse and donkey (different species)


Horse うま Donkey ロバ Mule ラバ
https://www.chegg.com/learn/topic/biological-species-concept

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why the BSC?

Members of the same species can exchange genes
Members of different species cannot
Member of the same species are an evolutionary unit

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Speciation


https://evolution.berkeley.edu/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why measure biodiversity using species?


Conceptually simple
According to the BSC, we are preserving evolutionary units

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Are there any disadvantages to measuring biodiversity with species richness?
text:
Are there any disadvantages to measuring biodiversity with species richness?


Does not account for evolutionary history
The BSC is difficult to test experimentally
The BSC does not apply to all organisms

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Videos for next week

Genetic Variation, Gene Flow, and New Species
Genes and Biodiversity
Discovering the Tree of Life

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Introduction

We can’t cover everything there is to know about the biodiversity of Japan in one lecture, or one class.
日本の生物多様性は非常に大きなトピックなので、一回の授業、あるいは一つの授業だけはとてもカバーが出来ません。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Introduction

I will introduce key concepts その代わり、重要なコンセプトを紹介します

We will continue to learn about these throughout the course コース全体を通して、これらについて学び続けます
You should use these to learn more on your own 各自でより深く学ぶために、これらを活用してください

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Introduction

After watching the lecture, please complete the online activity
講義を視聴した後、オンライン・アクティビティに参加してください

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Recommended reading


“Japan: The Natural History of an Asian Archipelago”, by Mark Brazil

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Japan has exceptionally high biodiversity


Example: Native species in Japan (378,000 sq km) vs. British Isles (315,000 sq km) 日本とイギリスの種数の比較（native = 在来種）


Plants: 5,300 vs. 1,623
Fish: 3,850 vs. 315
Mammals: 107 vs. 42




https://www.maff.go.jp/hokuriku/kokuei/shinacho/attach/pdf/koho-8.pdf

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Japan has diverse climate



Japan has a long shape from North to South 日本は南北に長い
Variation in climate: subarctic 亜寒帯to subtropical 亜熱帯
Variation in elevation
Highly diverse ecosystems

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Japan has complicated geography



Situated at boundaries of multiple tectonic plates 複数のプレートが一緒になるところに位置する
Extremely high geologic activity (earthquakes and mountain formation) 地震や火山が多い




https://www.researchgate.net/profile/W-Spakman/publication/353594344

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Japan has complicated geography



Separated from mainland ca. 25 million years ago やく2,500万年前に大陸から離れた
Re-connected at three points　３カ所で再度に大陸と繋がった

Hokkadio to Russia
Honshu to Korea
Okinawa to Taiwan

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Japan is affected by glaciers



Glaciers grow and shrink due to changes in global temperature 氷河は地球の温度に伴い、大きくなったり縮んだりする




https://www.snexplores.org/article/scientists-say-glacier

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Glaciers come and go in cycles
text:
Glaciers come and go in cycles

When glaciers are large (glacial maximum 氷期), sea levels are low
When glaciers are small (inter-glacial periods 間氷期), sea levels are high
Glacial maxima and inter-glacial periods repeat in a cycle　氷期と間氷期が繰り返される
It is currently an inter-glacial period　現在は間氷期

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Glaciers come and go in cycles
text:
Glaciers come and go in cycles


isotope = 同位体
http://coastalchange.ucsd.edu/st4_climatechange/sealevel.html

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Global sea levels were lower during the last glacial maximum (LGM)
text:
Global sea levels were lower during the last glacial maximum (LGM)


LGM = 最終氷期極大期
https://www.iro.umontreal.ca/~vaucher/History/Evolution/images/Climate/IceAge_World.jpg

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Connections to the continent shaped biodiversity in Japan
text:
Connections to the continent shaped biodiversity in Japan

Organisms moved into Japan from the mainland when it was connected (glacial maxima) 氷期の間に日本は大陸と繋がっていたので、生物たちが日本へ渡ることができた
They became isolated and evolved into new species 日本で隔離されるようになって、新しい種へと進化した

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Example: Stoneflies


カワゲラ
Tojo et al. 2017 10.1111/ens.12261

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Deep-sea troughs shape biodiversity



The water is very deep in the Tsugaru strait between Hokkaido and Honshu, so those did not become connected during the LGM 津軽海峡がとても深いので、最終氷期極大期の間でも北海道と本州がつながることはなかった。




Modified from https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/d9/Japan_glaciation.gif

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Deep-sea troughs shape biodiversity

Animals that cannot easily cross over water could not disperse from Hokkaido into Honshu 水を簡単に渡れない動物は、北海道から本州に入ることが出来なかった。
There is a major difference in species between Hokkaido and Honshu today 現在、北海道と本州の間には大きな種の違いがある。
This border is known as “Blakiston’s line” この境界線は “ブラキストン線”と呼ばれている

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Deep-sea troughs shape biodiversity


https://note.com/htmf/n/nd7c6e0006c2c

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: But the story is not that simple…
text:
But the story is not that simple…



Recently, ancient DNA of brown bears was found in Honshu, indicating that they may have crossed the Tsugaru strait during the LGM 最近、ヒグマの古代DNAが本州から発見され、最終氷期極大期にヒグマが津軽海峡を渡った可能性が示された


Segawa et al. 2021 https://doi.org/10.1098/rsos.210518

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Similar gaps in southern Japan
琉球列島にも似たようなパターンがある


https://www.nies.go.jp/kokusai/tpm/tpm8/download/part2/p2_s2_11.pdf

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Summary of key concepts

Japan has diverse climate, which means many species adapted for different climates live in a small area 日本には多様な気候があり、異なる気候に適応した多くの種が狭い地域に生息している。
Japan has complicated geological history, which means many different species evolved over time 日本には複雑な地質学的歴史があり、そのために様々な種が進化することが出来た。
Growth of glaciers affects sea level, and thereby connections between islands 氷河の成長は海面に影響を与え、それによって島と島のつながりが変化する。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Activity: Exploring biodiversity patterns in Japan
text:
Activity: Exploring biodiversity patterns in Japan

In this activity, you will use an interactive map (https://biodiversity-map.thinknature-japan.com/en/) to explore patterns of biodiversity in native vascular plants of Japan
このアクティビティでは、インタラクティブ・マップ（https://biodiversity-map.thinknature-japan.com/en/）を使って、日本の維管束植物の生物多様性のパターンを探ります。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Activity: Exploring biodiversity patterns in Japan
text:
Activity: Exploring biodiversity patterns in Japan

Please fill out the Google Form for the activity by 2024-07-01 23:59
7月1日 23:59までにGoogleフォームに記入してください。
The link to the form (https://forms.gle/oDCMdf9RqNrJN4CV9) is available in Moodle and the course website
フォームへのリンクはMoodleとコースウェブサイトにあります。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Announcements

The Media Day (Day 4) video and required activity are posted on Moodle. Complete the video and activity by 7/1 23:59.
Midterm is next week (7/2). I will explain more at the end of today’s lecture.

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Quiz

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Biodiversity is not just about species
text:
Biodiversity is not just about species

Diversity exists within species 種の中にも生物多様性が存在する
Species have evolutionary history 種には進化的な歴史がある

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Alleles

Allele = alternative versions of a gene
アリル = 対立遺伝子。一つの遺伝子に複数の種類があった場合、その一つ。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Alleles

Phenotype = 表現型
Genotype = 遺伝子型

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Gene pool




Gene pool = the total genetic diversity within a population or species
遺伝子プール：種あるいは集団の中に存在する遺伝子の総体

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Activity: which is more diverse?

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Populations with low genetic diversity are vulnerable
text:
Populations with low genetic diversity are vulnerable



Genetic diversity is linked to species-level diversity: if enough populations die, the species may go extinct
遺伝的多様性は種レベルの多様性と関連している：もし十分な数の個体群が死滅すれば、種は絶滅するかもしれない。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Phylogenetic trees represent evolution

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Phylogenetic trees represent evolution

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Connections matter, not order of tips
text:
Connections matter, not order of tips
You may read the tips left to right, but that does not mean the tip on the right is “more evolved”. 系統樹を読む際は左から右へとラベルを読むかもしれないけど、右の種は「より進化した」わけではない。


https://evolution.berkeley.edu/the-tree-room/evolutionary-trees-a-primer/tips-for-tree-reading/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Connections matter, not order of tips
text:
Connections matter, not order of tips
The same tree can be represented multiple ways. 一つの系統関係には複数の表し方がある。


https://evolution.berkeley.edu/the-tree-room/evolutionary-trees-a-primer/tips-for-tree-reading/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Phylogenetic trees tell us about biogeography of Japan
text: Phylogenetic trees tell us about biogeography of Japan

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Group Activity: Build a phylogenetic tree
text:
Group Activity: Build a phylogenetic tree
Build a phylogenetic tree including: owl, carp, rhinoceros, frog, starfish

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Build a phylogenetic tree: Step 1
List characteristics of each species 共通に持っている特徴を探す

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Build a phylogenetic tree: Step 2
Convert the list into a matrix リストをマトリックスに変換する

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Build a phylogenetic tree: Step 3
Use the matrix to build a concentric circles diagram (Venn diagram) マトリックスを使って同心円図（ベン図）を作る

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Build a phylogenetic tree: Step 4
Connect species from the Venn diagram to build the tree ベン図から種をつなげて系統樹を作る

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Build a phylogenetic tree: Step 5
Indicate on the tree where the characteristics evolved その特徴がどこで進化したのかを系統樹に示す。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Activity: Which area is more diverse?
text: Activity: Which area is more diverse?

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
About the midterm (7/2)

Topics covered 試験に出るトピック

Day 2, Global distribution of biodiversity
Day 3, Levels of biodiversity
Media day, Distribution of biodiversity in Japan

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
About the midterm (7/2)

30 minutes long
Multiple choice and short answer 多肢選択式と記述式
No computers or smartphones ラップトップ、携帯など禁止
1 page (A4, both sides) of hand-written notes allowed A4一枚（両面）の手書きメモはオッケー

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
About the on-demand lecture activity

In this activity, you will use an interactive map (https://biodiversity-map.thinknature-japan.com/en/) to explore patterns of biodiversity in native vascular plants of Japan
このアクティビティでは、インタラクティブ・マップ（https://biodiversity-map.thinknature-japan.com/en/）を使って、日本の維管束植物の生物多様性のパターンを探ります。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
About the on-demand lecture activity

Please fill out the Google Form for the activity by 2024-07-01 23:59
7月1日 23:59までにGoogleフォームに記入してください。
The link to the form (https://forms.gle/oDCMdf9RqNrJN4CV9) is available in Moodle and the course website
フォームへのリンクはMoodleとコースウェブサイトにあります。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Midterm test

30 minutes long
5 minute break after test
You may answer in English or Japanese

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
What are ecosystems?



Networks of interacting organisms
「生態系」とは、相互作用する生物のネットワーク






https://www.nature.com/scitable/knowledge/library/food-web-concept-and-applications-84077181/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: The composition of ecosystems differs across the globe
text:
The composition of ecosystems differs across the globe

生態系は場所によって構造が違う。
From a conservation standpoint we need to save each one
保全的な観点からすると、それぞれ保全すべき価値がある

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Ecosystems are not static

Ecosystems change (succession) 生態系は変わることがある（遷移）

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Primary succession: when an ecosystem develops from bare rock
text:
Primary succession: when an ecosystem develops from bare rock
一次遷移：溶岩台地などの土壌もない裸地や新しい湖沼などから始まる遷移


https://news.uchicago.edu/explainer/what-is-ecological-succession https://www.shinrin-ringyou.com/shinrin_seitai/seni.php

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Secondary succession: when an ecosystem develops after major disturbance
text:
Secondary succession: when an ecosystem develops after major disturbance
二次遷移：大きな撹乱が起こった後の遷移


https://news.uchicago.edu/explainer/what-is-ecological-succession

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Activity: Which is more diverse?

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Intermediate disturbance hypothesis
Ecosystems reach highest diversity at intermediate levels of disturbance
中ぐらいの撹乱で種数が最も多くなる（仮定）


https://stephenthomforde.com/intermediate-disturbance-hypothesis-idh/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Disturbance is natural

When humans suppress natural change, it lowers biodiversity
撹乱は自然現象である
人間が自然に起こる撹乱を抑えると、生物多様性が低下する

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Japan has diverse ecosystems


Brazil 2022, Japan: The Natural History of an Asian Archipelago

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Japan has diverse ecosystems


Brazil 2022, Japan: The Natural History of an Asian Archipelago

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Ecosystems are linked to ecosystem services （生態系サービス）
text:
Ecosystems are linked to ecosystem services （生態系サービス）
Healthy ecosystems have benefits for people
健康的な状態を保った生態系は人間にとって有利

Direct　直接的

Example: food from plants

Indirect　間接的

Example: mangroves prevent coastal erosion

Aesthetic/ethical　美的・倫理的

Example: trees in parks relieve daily stress

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Activity: Discuss ecosystem services


List as many ecosystem services as you can in your group (at least 10)
Arrange them in the Venn diagram. Put a star next to ecosystem services that you experience yourself.
Share your results with the class. What are services that show up in multiple categories?

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Example to satoyama: Misato, Kumamoto


久保田康裕・生物多様性研究室シンクネイチャー

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Satoyama are complex ecosystems with human interactions
text:
Satoyama are complex ecosystems with human interactions
里山は人間との相互作用による複雑な生態系
Not one ecosystem, but many

“Traditional, rural landscapes, which are social and ecological networks of a village and its surroundings, which include agricultural lands, open forest lands and forests, and which have maintained a high diversity of plants, insects, and small-to-medium-sized animals”

Fukamachi (2001, Landsc. Ecol. 16: 703–717)

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Satoyama are widely distributed throughout Japan
text:
Satoyama are widely distributed throughout Japan


里山は日本全国に広く分布している

https://www.biodic.go.jp/biodiversity/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: In satoyama, humans benefit from the ecosystem and help maintain biodiversity
text:
In satoyama, humans benefit from the ecosystem and help maintain biodiversity
里山では、人間をが生物多様性を維持すると同時に恩恵を受ける

Cutting trees prevents any one species from becoming dominant 樹木を伐採することで、種のどれか一つだけが圧倒的に多くなることを防ぐ
Watering of rice paddies provides habitat for wetland species 水田への散水は湿地生物に生息地を提供する

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Satoyama are being lost due to population shrinkage
text:
Satoyama are being lost due to population shrinkage
人口減少で失われつつある里山

The current population of Japan is shrinking 現在の日本の人口は減少している
Most young people are in the cities 若者の多くは都会にいる
There are fewer and fewer people to manage satoyama, so biodiversity is being lost 里山を管理する人が少なくなり、生物多様性が失われている

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: The Japanese government is trying to conserve satoyama
text:
The Japanese government is trying to conserve satoyama
日本政府は里山の保全に取り組んでいる


https://www.env.go.jp/nature/satoyama/En_ActionPlan_summary_ver.pdf

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Reminder: Quiz next week
Watch the videos and be ready for a quiz next week (7/9)

Field Methods for Documenting Biodiversity
Human Activities That Threaten Biodiversity
Introduced Species and Biodiversity
How Does Climate Change Affect Biodiversity?

text:
Quiz

Visit https://gosocrative.com and enter room name JABIOD2024, or scan the barcode:

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Who is responsible for conservation policy in Japan?
text:
Who is responsible for conservation policy in Japan?


National level 国レベル

Ministry of the Environment 環境省

National Parks 国立公園

Forestry Agency 林野省

Protected Forests 保護林

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Who is responsible for conservation policy in Japan?
text:
Who is responsible for conservation policy in Japan?



Prefectural and local governments 県（と県以下）の政府

Prefectural parks and quasi-national parks 都道府県立自然公園と国定公園



https://www.pref.chiba.lg.jp/shizen/kouen/shizenkouen/index.html





Suigo-Tsukuba Quasi-National Park, Chiba 水郷筑波国定公園

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Who is responsible for conservation policy in Japan?
text:
Who is responsible for conservation policy in Japan?



International 国際

World Heritage Sites 世界遺産
Ramsar Sites (wetlands) ラムサール条約湿地






https://www.jelf-justice.org/statement/statement-1991/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Overlap of protected areas



Multiple layers of protection 保護地域は重複可能
But can be confusing 混乱しやすい

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
What is the Red List?
レッドリストとは？

The Red List is a list of endangered species 絶滅危惧種のリスト
The original Red List was created by the International Union for the Conservation of Nature (IUCN) at the global level 原型は、国際自然保護連合（IUCN）が世界レベルで作成したもの
The Red list has no legal status, but is used as a source of information for shaping policy 法的地位はないが、政策形成のための情報源として利用されている

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Red List of Japan

The Ministry of the Environment compiles two documents for species in Japan 環境省は日本の種について以下の2つの文書を作成している

Japan Red List: like the IUCN Red List, but specific to Japan ジャパン・レッドリスト：国際自然保護連合（IUCN）のレッドリストに似ているが、日本の種だけを扱う
Japan Red Data Book: additional data about each species in the list 日本版レッドデータブック：リストに掲載されている種に関する追加データ

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Restoration of species in Japan



Example: Crested Ibis (Nipponia nippon) トキ

Became extinct from Japan in 2003 2003年に日本から絶滅
Reintroduced from China in 2008  2008年に中国から再導入
Now nearly 500 birds on Sado Island  現在、佐渡島に500羽近く生息







https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/c3/Nipponia_nippon.jpg

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: How you can contribute to conservation
text:
How you can contribute to conservation


日本の自然保護に貢献するには

Experience biodiversity!  生物多様性を体験する

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: How you can contribute to conservation
text:
How you can contribute to conservation

Experience biodiversity! 生物多様性を体験する

Explore nearby natural areas 近くの自然を探検する
Join a nature appreciation group 自然観察会に参加する
Explore world heritage sites in Japan 日本の世界遺産を巡る

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: How you can contribute to conservation
text:
How you can contribute to conservation



Use “My” things instead of buying new every time　毎回新しいものを買うのではなく、「マイ<何とか>」を使いましょう


https://tsunagood.net/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: How you can contribute to conservation
text:
How you can contribute to conservation

But beware of “eco-bags” - better to just buy fewer things in the first place! しかし、「エコバッグ」には気をつけよう。そもそも買うものを減らしたほうがいい！


a cotton bag should be used at least 7,100 times to make it a truly environmentally friendly alternative to a conventional plastic bag


https://edition.cnn.com/2023/03/13/world/reusable-grocery-bags-cotton-plastic-scn/index.html

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: How you can contribute to conservation
text:
How you can contribute to conservation



Talk with your friends about biodiversity 周りの方と生物多様性について話しましょう


https://daily.jstor.org/how-to-increase-diversity-in-community-science-projects/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: How you can contribute to conservation
text:
How you can contribute to conservation



Educate yourself 自分自身を教育する

Read the news about climate change 気候変動に関するニュースを読む
Use what you learned in this class as a foundation to understand your connection with nature このクラスで学んだことを基礎として、自然とのつながりを理解する

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Quiz

Visit https://gosocrative.com and enter room name JABIOD2024, or scan the barcode:

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Threats to biodiversity in Japan
日本における生物多様性への危機

Local

Development 開発
Artifical forests 人工林
Invasive species 外来種

Global: climate change 地球温暖化

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Development 開発



Japan is 70% mountainous, so population centers are concentrated on the coasts 日本は70％が山地であるため、人口の中心は沿岸部に集中している。
Wetlands are strongly impacted by development 湿地は開発の影響を強く受ける






https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/65c274fef431470cb9038e3997a7ca5b

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Artificial forests 人工林



In the 1950s and 60s, large areas were planted with lumber trees 1950年代から60年代にかけて、広大な土地に木材の木が植えられた（人工林）
But now demand is low, so many trees are unused しかし、現在は需要が少なく、多くの木が利用されていない。
Unmanaged plantations decrease biodiversity 管理されていない人工林は生物多様性を減少させる

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Invasive species 外来種



Black bass (for fishing)　　ブラックバス（釣り）






https://fishingjapan.jp/fishing/3626

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Invasive species 外来種



Mongoose (for snake control)　ングース（ヘビ対策）





“Mongooses don’t fight snakes. Professor responsible for creating nightmare invasive species.”





https://news.yahoo.co.jp/articles/e80de48a8bffe63ce053d5a15172de41463aeb19

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Climate change 地球温暖化



Flowering times have shifted earlier 開花時期が早まった

Pollinators may not be able to find their flowers 送粉者が花を見つけられない可能性がある。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Climate change 地球温暖化

Ocean warming causes coral bleaching in Okinawa　沖縄ではサンゴの白化現象が起こっている

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Documenting biodiversity
Conserving and documenting biodiversity are two sides of the same coin: you can’t have one without the other.
生物多様性の保全と記録は表裏一体である。
If we don’t know where species live, we can’t conserve them. If we don’t conserve them, there won’t be anything to study.
種がどこに生息しているのかわからなければ、保全することはできないし、生物種を保護しなければ、研究する対象もなくなってしまう。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Example: Survey of plants on Iriomote Island
text:
Example: Survey of plants on Iriomote Island
例：西表島の植物調査

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Final Project
For your final project, you will give a group presentation on a biodiversity hotspot.
最終プロジェクトとして、生物多様性のホットスポットについてグループ・プレゼンテーションを行う。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Final Project
Each group (3 total) chooses one hotspot

Global Hotspots (from Conservation International list)

Tropical Andes 熱帯アンデス
Cape Floristic Region ケープ植物区保護地域群

Hotspots in Japan

Ogasawara Islands 小笠原諸島
Okinawa Islands 沖縄諸島

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Example Hotspot Profile

https://www.calacademy.org/biodiversity-course

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Presentation should include:

Location of the hotspot 場所
Analysis of biodiversity 生物多様性の解析

What groups of organisms are particularly diverse? 特に多様性の高い生物群は？
Are there any particularly interesting species? 特に興味深い種はあるか？
How is biodiversity distributed within the area? 生物多様性は地域内でどのように分布しているか？
What evolutionary and geologic processes cause the high biodiversity? 生物多様性が高いのは、どのような進化的・地質的プロセスが原因か？

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Presentation should include:

Analysis of threats 危機の分析

How much area has already been lost to human activity? 人間の活動によって、すでにどれだけの面積が失われているのか？
What are the major threats posed? 主な危機は何か？

Conservation outlook 保全の見通し

What are the current conservation efforts and protection status? 現在の保全活動と保護状況は？
What needs to be done to save biodiversity in the future? 今後、生物多様性を保全するために何が必要か？

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Format

Time: 10~12 minutes
Language: English
You must cite your sources (more on that soon) 出典（参考文献）は必ず引用すること（詳しくは後述）

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Submission

Slides (Powerpoint)
Script (Microsoft Word, 5-6 pages double spaced, 12 point font)
Submit via Moodle by 5:50 PM on July 18

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Division of group work
By role (example):

Writer
Visual-director
Fact-checker
Proof-reader
Presenter

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Division of group work
By section/slide number (example):

Distribution of biodiversity (slides 1-3)
Threats to biodiversity (slides 4-6)
etc.

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Evaluations
You will evaluate each other group’s presentation (Form A), as well as the contributions of other members of your group (Form B). The evaluations will be used when grading.
各グループのプレゼンテーション（様式A）と、自分のグループの他のメンバーの貢献（様式B）を評価する。評価は採点の際に使用される。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Evaluations

Fill out Form A and Form B (Word documents) and submit via Moodle by 11:59 PM July 19.

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
About citing references

You need to cite sources in your slides when you use a direct quote, fact, or image スライドで直接的な引用、事実、画像を使用する場合は、出典を引用する必要がある。
You should try and determine if the source is trustworthy 出典が信頼できるかどうかを判断する必要がある。

Books and academic journal articles are preferable to websites ウェブサイトよりも書籍や学術雑誌の記事が望ましい。

Wikipedia is OK, but use the primary sources if possible ウィキペディアでも構わないが、可能であれば一次資料を使うこと。

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
References: How to find
What is the number of plant species on Madagascar?
Find Wikipedia article by Google search　まずはググってみる

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
References: How to find
Find text in Wikipedia article, which cites another source ウィキペディアの記事から、別の出典を引用している文章を見つける

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
References: How to find
Look up the source in the reference list 文献リストから出典を調べる

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
References: How to find
Check the original source 元々の出典を確認

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
References: How to find
Check the original source 元々の出典を確認

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
References: Example slide
Madagascar has 11,399 species of native vascular plants (82% endemic) (Madagascar Catalog)
Main threats include deforestation, overgrazing, and internal migration (CEPF)

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
References: Example reference List
References Cited

Critical Ecosystem Partnership Fund (CEPF). Madagascar and the Indian Ocean Islands Biodiversity Hotspot Ecosystem Profile. [https://www.cepf.net/sites/default/files/cepf-ecosystem-profile-madio-2022-en-2.pdf] Accessed: July 11, 2023.
Madagascar Catalogue. Catalogue of the Vascular Plants of Madagascar. Missouri Botanical Garden, St. Louis, U.S.A. & Antananarivo, Madagascar [https://www.tropicos.org/Project/Madagascar] Accessed: July 11, 2023.

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Recommended sources

Japan

日本の多様性ホットスポットの構造に関する研究 (Biological Properties of Biodiversity Hotspots in Japan)
生物多様性国家戦略 2023-2030 (National Biodiversity Strategy of Japan, 2023-2030)

Global

Critical Ecosystem Partnership Fund, “Explore the Biodiversity Hotspots”

Especially the “Ecosystem Profile” of each hotspot
